intro: Corydalis incisa var. koreana, commonly known as Korean narrowleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing blue to purple flowers that are attractive to pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct narrowing at the base, giving it a unique appearance. It prefers well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or woodland settings.
